Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Clavanin C  (His-rich classic; natural AMPs; Sea squirt, tunicate, marine invertebrates, animals; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against E. coli  ML-35p,  L. monocytogenes  EGD  and  C. albicans  in  radial  diffusion  assays (dose dependent, see Fig. 6 in the ref). More active than Clavanin A or B (see ref). A recent study revealed increased antimicrobial activity in the presence of Zn2+ but not Cu2+: Clavanin C is active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 16 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 43300 MRSA (MIC 16 ug/ml), and C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 16 ug/ml) in the presence of Zn2+ (Miller et al., 2021) (Provided by Adriana Miller). Updated 7/2021; 2/2023
Literature Information.Author: Lee IH, Zhao C, Cho Y, Harwig SSL, Cooper EL, Lehrer RI.1997
Literature Information.Title: Clavanins, alpha-helical antimicrobial peptides from tunicate hemocytes.
